body.p: The HTML pages that comprise the output of a WebHelp Responsive system are obtained after processing HTML template pages. An HTML page template is a HTML file that include one or more WebHelp template components like: publication title, breadcrumb and others.

All the WebHelp HTML files are generated based on the HTML page templates. These pages are stored by default in the WebHelp core resources com.oxygenxml.webhelp.responsive/oxygen-webhelp/page-templates.
If you want to change the structure of these pages (you want to add a new HTML component, move some components in other places) you can specify these pages in a template.
body.codeblock: <publishing-template> ... <webhelp> ... <!-- HTML page templates --> <html-page-templates> <page-template page="main" file="page-templates/wt_index.html"/> <page-template page="search" file="page-templates/wt_search.html"/> <page-template page="topic" file="page-templates/wt_topic.html"/> <page-template page="index-terms" file="page-templates/wt_terms.html"/> </html-page-templates>

p.note: If you want to specify the HTML page templates in a publishing template it is necessarily to specify all of them: topic, search, main page and terms. In other words, you are not allowed to specify only a single HTML page template.
